result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason J Hernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Cash bail applied to Court costs ($343).  Balance of Court costs and DNA surcharge ($200) are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

No violent contact with the victim.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Not to operate a motor vehicle  without a valid license.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Cases 07CT1799, 09CM875, 09CM876, 09CT622, 09CT704 and 14CM434 were dismissed and read in.

records.addlTxt: Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Attorney Wolff.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Jason J Hernandez in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Konrad Paczuski, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 2,  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 1 dismissed and read in.  Cases 07CT1799, 09CM875, 09CM876, 09CT622, 09CT704 and 14CM434 dismissed and read in to this matter.

Court orders the following:
- 75 days jail - straight time. STAYED
- 1 year Probation. 
- Court costs of $343.00; cash bail from 07CT1799, 07CT2026, 09CM875, 09CM876, 09CT622 and 09CT704 to be applied.  Any remaining costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
- Conditions of Probation:  Follow through with any treatment/counseling deemed appropriate by Agent.  No violent contact with victim.  Maintain employment.  Defendant no to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
Demand for Discovery with attached Jury Demand filed by Attorney Wolff.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jason J Hernandez in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Peter M Wolff.    
Defense waiting on a consolidated offer.
File not called on the record.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant doesn't qualify for Public Defender Representation.
Therefore, Court on it's own motion appoints Atty. Peter Wolff to represent the defendant on all cases.    Contract appointment.
Hearing on June 26, 2015 at 09:00 am.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jason J Hernandez in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail).   
Cases called along with:  07CT2026, 09CM875, 09CM876, 09CT622, 09CT704, 14CM434 & 07CT1799
Court addressed the Defendant's request for Bail Modification on all files.
Defendant presented statements to the court.
Court Denied - Bail Modification.
All Bail and Conditions remain as previously fixed.
Court will be willing to readdress bail on the next court date.
  Hearing scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 09:00 am.
